title: Chelsea boss Antonio Conte insists he will not overhaul tactics despite win streak ending at Tottenham
text:

Antonio Conte has rejected suggestions he will overhaul his Chelsea side's tactics once again after defeat at Tottenham. 
The Italian pulled off a masterstroke when he changed to a 3-4-3 formation following a heavy defeat at Arsenal - which led to a 13-game win streak. 
But despite coming up short in the 2-0 loss at White Hart Lane, Conte remains calm and content with his tactics moving forward. 
"We found a good balance with this formation and we continue with it," Conte said in his post-match press-conference. Conte embraces Nemanja Matic and Diego Costa after defeat (Photo: Julian Finney) Read More 
"But it's very strange you ask me after a defeat after 13 wins in a row if I'm thinking of changing the formation. 
"I am seeing that to stop us other teams are changing the formation." 
Conte, while dejected at the historic run ending, warmly reflected on a sensational streak that has put the Blues in prime position to win the title. Antonio Conte and Mauricio Pochettino share a joke before the match (Photo: Reuters) Dele Alli heads home the second to put the game beyond Chelsea (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC/Getty Images) 
"We are disappointed but also we must be pleased," Conte added. 
"Because to win 13 games in a row is not easy in this league, and also today we lost against a good team, a really strong team." poll loading Will Antonio Conte lead Chelsea to the title? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
